poem:
"Eulogy of a Baffling Grid"

29,338 puzzles, all inked in formal dance,
Newsprint veils hide truths, spiteful in their advance,
A war of wits, birthed from black and white stance,
Diced and spliced in silence, numbers prance.
Cryptic lines enslave, in cerebral romance,
A prize crossword, weaving the day's trance.
Mourn its passing, this transient happenstance,
Just paper. Yet, it commands the mind's expanse.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Prize crossword No 29,338". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
